Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery oinochoe; white slip; exterior: part of broad back band; oblique bars filled with dots.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1886,0401.1267.d, 1924,1201.35, 1886,0401.1125 and 1924,1201.1157. It gives part of the right wing. According to Cook, the decoration seems to have been inspired by the conventional representation of a bird, specifically a partridge: scales for the breast feathers and bars for the folded wings. The breast-feather panel narrowing towards the bottom and the red on these feathers are unusual; the black bands are unusually wide. For a complete oinochoe with this decoration, see Walter-Karydi 1973, pl. 4, no. 47 from Rhodes. For parallels, see Louvre A321 from Camiros.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 8, no. 1, pl. 8, no. 1)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 247, no. 3b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.146)
